instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1466: What is A1466? A1466 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Air from years Early 2015, 2017, Mid 2012, Mid 2013, Early 2014 with EMC 2925, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00165, 820-3209, 820-3437..
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message:
Power rails measure normal, am getting .46 V on <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>

No visible corrosion but signs of water damage.

Not sure how to diagnose low voltage on this line, how should I proceed?

Thankyou!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message:
Do you get all other normal voltages, excepting CPU core?
Check if <CHIP>U7310</CHIP>/20 are correctly powered and look if <RESISTOR>R7311</RESISTOR>/21 and <CAPACITOR>C7311</CAPACITOR>/21 are all good/present.
Also check <CHIP>U7200</CHIP> area, <SIGNAL>VR_ON</SIGNAL>, VIN, VDD.
Is sufficient one corroded small resistor; and there are many, too many...
You may also consider to change the MOSFETs from CPU power supply.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R7311</RESISTOR>/21 = 4.8V
<CAPACITOR>C7311</CAPACITOR>/21 = 4.8V

<CHIP>U7310</CHIP> Pin 8 (Phase) is getting the same .46V as <SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL>

These readings do not match my known good board. Is this a step in the right direction?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1466</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 820 3437 Board No Power , No Chime, No Fan Spin
threads.message: No use in measuring Vcore if there is not even fan spin. Check all S4/S3 rails first if present then all S0 rails. <SIGNAL>S0_CPU</SIGNAL> will be the very last rail to come on and the fan should spin first.
